title: Is it feasible to develop a 'dosimeter' type device for detecting and measuring levels of coronavirus near the person wearing the instrument? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Is it feasible to develop a ‘dosimeter’ type device for detecting and measuring levels of coronavirus near the person wearing the instrument?” Dogs have been trained to detect the infected, so the answer might be close to “yes”. But it will be a very “on/off” detection, and may not trigger on any but those showing massive symptoms. I will however say “no”, and point out that it is not “how much total” you have been exposed to, but “how much in so many minutes”. More like a Geiger Mueller tube with some short term integration.

If they could measure the virus in your air space then it would be too late. There were ideas that all smart phone owners could be alerted if people with positive tests in the last two weeks were in your vicinity. Apple and Amazon published identical programs early in the pandemic but they didn’t warn you. Only 50,000 downloaded them because they didn’t help you but made you traceable. The Big Brother watching was a deal breaker
